intro: Centaurea prolongi, commonly known as the long-headed centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a compact, bushy growth habit. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with a distinctive elongated central disk. Centaurea prolongi is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in poor soils.
